intro: Odontonema lucidum, commonly known as the shining stinging nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving them a shiny appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, typically greenish-white in color. Odontonema lucidum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
